meanings.definition: A grass that is cultivated for its edible grains.
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted cereal in the field for harvesting.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, I enjoy a bowl of cereal with milk.
meanings.sent3: Why did the wheat and rice go to the party? They heard it was a cereal-killer event!
meanings.sent4: The fields of golden wheat swayed like waves of cereal in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the ripe cereal ready for harvest was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A breakfast food made from roasted grain.
meanings.sent1: My favorite breakfast is a bowl of cereal with fresh fruit.
meanings.sent2: In the morning rush, many people opt for a quick bowl of cereal.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cornflakes go to school? To become a cereal-ist!
meanings.sent4: The aroma of toasted cereal filled the kitchen with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The crunch of the cereal was music to my ears.

meanings.definition: Any plant of the grass family yielding an edible grain.
meanings.sent1: The fields were filled with different types of cereal ready for harvest.
meanings.sent2: Ancient civilizations relied on various cereals as their main food source.
meanings.sent3: Why did the barley break up with the oats? It couldn't handle the cereal monogamy!
meanings.sent4: The vast expanse of cereal fields stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The history of cereal cultivation dates back thousands of years.
